stories.title: Fix Sentiment and TalkTime charts plotting null values at top of chart
acceptance: Sentiment chart does not render data points at the top of the chart
TalkTime chart does not render data points at the top of the chart
Both charts show gaps where data is null (no line drawn through null points at top)
Non-null data points still connect smoothly
Volume chart behaviour unchanged

stories.title: Fix transcript attendee sidebar speaker color mismatch
acceptance: Speaker avatar color in attendees sidebar matches the same speaker's avatar color in the transcript
Speaker name text color matches avatar background color
Attendees sidebar uses speaker-name-based slot lookup (not array index)

stories.title: Credits navbar: show 'N credits' label and add pulsating green dot
acceptance: Credits button shows '342 credits' not '342 cr'
Green status dot next to credits pulsates (like notification dot) using animate-pulse in green
Pulse is subtle — not distracting

stories.title: Dashboard Activity tab: add entry animation matching Team Performance
acceptance: Switching to Activity tab triggers fade-in + slide-up animation (opacity 0→1, y 20→0)
Animation matches the motion.div pattern used in TeamKPIGrid
Content width/scaling is consistent with Overview tab

stories.title: Meetings tab: add consistent spacing to match app standard padding
acceptance: Meetings list content has px-4 sm:px-6 lg:px-8 horizontal padding
Vertical padding matches app standard (py-6 sm:py-8)
Content is no longer flush to screen edges
Pattern matches MeetingAnalyticsPage and Dashboard padding

stories.title: Fix Most Popular badge clipped by CreditPurchaseModal card border
acceptance: Most Popular badge renders fully above the card's border (not overlapping/clipped by it)
Badge is visually floating above the top edge of the popular card
Other pack cards are unaffected

stories.title: Replace 'cr' abbreviation with 'credits' throughout credit UI
acceptance: All visible 'cr' abbreviations replaced with 'credits' (e.g. '342 cr' → '342 credits')
Per-unit rates updated (e.g. 'cr/mo' → 'credits/mo', 'cr/day' → 'credits/day')
No regressions in credit display logic
